meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! I'm so excited to dive into this delightful remade RPG, Wizardry: Proving Grounds of the Mad Overlord. But before we get started, let's take a quick glance at what some other critics have been saying.

First off, we've got Hardcore Gamer giving it a 70 out of 100, praising its nostalgic value and punishing gameplay experience. Then there's IGN Italia with a similar score, calling it "competent" but also stating that it remained too faithful to the original game. The Games Machine is a bit more generous, awarding it a 73, highlighting Digital Eclipse's masterful recreation of a classic. Multiplayer.it gives it an 80, commending its great remake status, but cautioning that it might be too hard for modern audiences. And finally, SECTOR.sk gives it a 65, acknowledging the original's strengths while also noting some "ailments" it suffered from.

Now, let's get to my review! As I played through this charming RPG, I couldn't help but think of all the delightful challenges it presents. You see, Wizardry is an old-school dungeon crawler that's just begging to be explored. With a steep learning curve and punishing difficulty levels, this game is perfect for those who love a good challenge.

As you navigate the procedurally generated dungeons, you'll need to strategize, plan, and execute with precision. And trust me, it's a rush like no other! The game has this wonderful nostalgic charm that will transport you back to the heyday of RPGs. But don't worry if you're new to the series; the pre-made characters and gradual learning curve make it accessible for newcomers.

So what's my verdict? Well, I won't say anything just yet... Let's just say that Wizardry: Proving Grounds of the Mad Overlord is a treat for any RPG enthusiast. With its addictive gameplay, charming graphics, and rich storyline, this game is sure to capture your heart. So grab your trusty sword, don your favorite cloak, and get ready for an adventure of epic proportions!
